intro: Schizocalyx veraguensis, commonly known as the Veraguas schizocalyx, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a velvety texture. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests.
